overview.title: Family Registration Certificate (FRC)
overview.description: The Family Registration Certificate (FRC) is an official NADRA-issued document that shows your registered family members exactly as recorded in NADRA's database on the date of issuance. It confirms and verifies family relationships for legal, immigration, and official purposes.
overview.legal_basis: The FRC is issued under Schedule XI of Rule 19 of the NADRA (NIC) Rules, 2002.
primary_use: Verification of family relationships for legal or official matters
overview.validity_note: The certificate reflects family data available in NADRA records at the time it is issued.

categories.includes: Shows details of your parents and siblings.
categories.when_to_choose: Select this category if you need proof of your family before marriage.

categories.includes: Shows details of your spouse and children.
categories.when_to_choose: Choose this option if you are married and need to verify your immediate family.

categories.includes: Shows details of your guardian and adopted family members.
categories.when_to_choose: Applicable for adopted individuals or guardianship-related verification.

categories.includes: Shows details of both birth and marriage families (alpha and beta family members).
categories.when_to_choose: Select this if you need a complete family record in a single certificate.

eligibility.basic_requirement: All listed family members should be registered with NADRA and have a valid 13-digit identification number.
allowed_exceptions: Deceased family members who were not registered
Unregistered living individuals in specific cases
eligibility.important_note: Details of unregistered family members are added based on information provided by the applicant and may require verification.

in_person.availability: Available nationwide, including E-Khidmat Markaz in Punjab.
steps: Visit your nearest NADRA Registration Center.
Obtain a token from the counter to begin your application.
If applying for minors, their photographs will be taken if the CRC does not already include a photo.
Your family data will be retrieved and shown to you for review.
Submit the applicable fee at the counter.
Your Family Registration Certificate will be printed and handed over immediately.
in_person.delivery_time: Issued in real-time during your visit.

steps: Log in to your Pak ID account or create a new account if you do not already have one.
From the Home screen, go to the Family section and select FRC.
Your family members' details will be displayed on the screen.
Carefully review all information. Any record highlighted in red requires correction before proceeding.
Select the appropriate FRC category based on your requirement.
Review your application summary and submit it.
Pay the applicable fee using the available online payment options.
After processing, download the FRC PDF from the ID Vault section of the app.
online.delivery_time: Digital FRC is usually available within 24 hours after fee submission.

applicant: Valid 13-digit CNIC, NICOP, POC, or CRC
family_members: Child Registration Certificate (CRC / Form-B) for children

special_cases.minor_children: Children under 18 years of age must be physically present if their CRC is issued without a photograph.
special_cases.deceased_family_member: The CNIC of a deceased family member must be canceled by submitting a Death Certificate issued by the Union Council, Municipal Corporation, or Cantonment Board.
special_cases.poc_holder: If a POC holder does not already exist in the family record, they must apply separately and add other family members as relatives.

online_application: Scanned or uploaded supporting documents as required

processing_time.nrc: Issued immediately during your visit to the NADRA Registration Center.
processing_time.pak_identity: Usually available within 24 hours after online fee submission.

allowed: Correction of English name spellings during FRC processing
not_allowed: Change of name or personal identity details
data_correction_rules.incomplete_records: Incomplete or outdated family records will not appear in the FRC until they are updated through NADRA.

important_notes: Application processing starts only after the fee has been successfully submitted.
The FRC reflects NADRA records as they exist on the date of issuance.
The FRC process, requirements, and fees are uniform across Pakistan.

help_and_support.description: If you face any issues during the application or need further assistance, the following official support channels are available.
help_and_support.important_note: Support availability and contact details may change. Always refer to official NADRA channels for the latest information.

faq.question: What is a Family Registration Certificate (FRC)?
faq.answer: An official NADRA-issued document that confirms your family composition based on NADRA records, including certain unregistered deceased or living members where applicable.

faq.question: How long does it take to receive an FRC?
faq.answer: FRCs are issued immediately at NADRA Registration Centers, while online applications usually take up to 24 hours.

faq.question: Can I apply for FRC online?
faq.answer: Yes, you can apply through the Pak Identity Mobile App and download the certificate digitally.

items.label: All family member names match passport and other documents exactly
English transliteration of names is accurate
Father's and mother's names are correctly listed
All CNIC numbers are correctly printed (13 digits)
Applicant's CNIC/NICOP number matches the certificate
CRC numbers for minors are correctly listed
All required family members are listed
Relationship types (spouse, child, parent) are accurate
FRC category matches your application need
Certificate has official NADRA seal and signature
Date of issuance is clearly visible
QR code or verification number is present
No visible damage, stains, or alterations

tips: New certificates typically issued instantly in real-time or take 1 day while applying via app if all documents are ready.
Corrections require supporting documents proving the correct information.
Replacement certificates can usually be issued same-day if original registration exists in NADRA database.
pitfalls: Don't apply without ensuring all family members are registered with NADRA first.
Avoid applying for the wrong FRC category — verify your need beforehand.
Don't submit correction requests without official supporting documents.

tips: Your nearest NADRA center is based on your current residential address.
Urban areas generally have NADRA Mega Centers for faster processing.
Some districts in AJK and Gilgit-Baltistan may have limited center availability.
pitfalls: Don't assume any NADRA center can process your request — check availability.
Avoid visiting on Fridays after 12 PM as most centers close early.
Remote areas may require travel to the nearest district headquarters.

tips: Gather all required documents before visiting the NADRA center.
Visit during weekday mornings for shorter wait times.
FRC is printed and handed over immediately at NRC — no need to revisit.
pitfalls: Don't visit without original CNIC — photocopies alone are not accepted for biometric verification.
Missing family member documents will delay your application.
Unregistered family members must be added to NADRA records before FRC issuance.

tips: Confirm office hours before visiting; some close early on Fridays.
Bring photocopies of all documents in addition to originals.
Fee amounts: PKR 1,000 for single category, PKR 2,000 for By All.
pitfalls: Don't rely on unofficial centers — only visit authorized NADRA Registration Centers.
Office listings and contact information may change; always confirm before visiting.
Avoid peak hours (10 AM - 1 PM) for faster service.

tips: Verify all spellings match your passport and other official documents exactly.
Check that the NADRA seal and signature are clearly visible on the certificate.
Ensure the FRC category matches what the embassy or visa office requires.
pitfalls: Don't submit an FRC with spelling mismatches — it will be rejected by embassies.
Avoid using an expired or outdated FRC; some embassies require recent issuance.
Don't assume the FRC is correct without verifying every listed family member.
